Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2011 12:49AM KindOfScared wrote: Hi irishlasse:  You have found a great place to express yourself.  I started up my friendships with my new breast friends on this site after being told I needed another mammogram.  Scared me.  I had never had to have a second one before.  That turned into biopsy on both breasts, MRI, ultrasound, MRI and now facing the scheduling of a lumpectomy the most likely radiation and possibly tamoxifen.  Although each test and waiting for results has been stressful, I couldn't imagine not doing them.  We have so much technology out there now and it is saving lives.  My DCIS would not have been detected without my mammogram.  I am extremely lucky.  If I were one that waited until I felt something, things would not be looking as good as they do for me.  I realize this is a bit of a longwinded note to you but my point I am trying to make to you is, don't wait.  Get it biopsied.  Having a biopsy is not a big deal.  Wondering what is in there is.  If it is just a cyst, great.  If it is something that needs further investigation, the sooner you know the better.   I think you know that though it is nice to have the gals here (and some men actually) also share their experience and thoughts.  We are all here to help each other.  Best of luck to you.
